meanings.definition: To take the place of (someone or something) by force or scheming.
meanings.sent1: The new manager was supplanting the old one with clever tactics.
meanings.sent2: The ambitious candidate aimed at supplanting the current leader in the upcoming election.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was supplanting the birds at the feeder, causing a commotion.
meanings.sent4: The rising star in the music industry was supplanting the established artists with their unique style.
meanings.sent5: The young prince was supplanting the aging king, eager to take over the throne.

meanings.definition: To remove or displace (someone or something) from a position of power or influence.
meanings.sent1: The scandal led to the CEO supplanting the company's board of directors.
meanings.sent2: The revolution aimed at supplanting the oppressive regime with a more democratic system.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was supplanting the dog as the favorite pet in the household.
meanings.sent4: The new technology was supplanting traditional methods in the industry, causing a shift in power.
meanings.sent5: The young athlete was supplanting the veteran player as the team captain, signaling a change in leadership.
